articles.headline: In Health Care Ruling, Investors See a Mixed Blessing
articles.snippet: The shares of major insurers suffered a modest dip on Thursday, while pharmaceutical and device companies fell slightly, and hospital stocks rose.
articles.abstract: The shares of major insurers suffered a modest dip on Thursday, while pharmaceutical and device companies fell slightly, and hospital stocks rose.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hospitals will gain millions of paying customers. Insurers, by contrast, could face crimped profits from restrictive rules. Medical device and pharmaceutical companies will bear new taxes and other higher payouts, but they were already expecting such costs.
articles.byline: By Andrew Pollack and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: G.O.P. Vowing to Take Battle Over Health Care Law Into November
articles.snippet: Both President Obama and Mitt Romney looked for advantages in the health care ruling to use in their presidential campaigns.
articles.abstract: Both President Obama and Mitt Romney looked for advantages in the health care ruling to use in their presidential campaigns.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mitt Romney and other Republicans who oppose the health care law are looking ahead to one remaining avenue of appeal: the ballot box in November.

articles.headline: Funds and Allies Defend the Buck
articles.snippet: Money market funds can claim net asset values of $1 a share, without reserves and with an implicit government guarantee, but the Securities and Exchange Commission could change that.
articles.abstract: Money market funds can claim net asset values of $1 a share, without reserves and with an implicit government guarantee, but the Securities and Exchange Commission could change that.

articles.headline: In Setback, RIM Delays BlackBerry’s Next Version
articles.snippet: Research in Motion, the company behind BlackBerry phones, also reported a $518 million loss for the first quarter.
articles.abstract: Research in Motion, the company behind BlackBerry phones, also reported a $518 million loss for the first quarter.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — Research in Motion unexpectedly announced on Thursday that a new line of phones that it still hopes will revive its BlackBerry brand will be delayed until next year.

articles.headline: A Vindication, With a Legacy Still Unwritten
articles.snippet: With the central pillar of his agenda left intact, President Obama may yet join the ranks of presidents who fundamentally altered the course of the country.
articles.abstract: With the central pillar of his agenda left intact, President Obama may yet join the ranks of presidents who fundamentally altered the course of the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For Barack Obama, who staked his presidency on a once-in-a-generation reshaping of the social welfare system, the Supreme Court’s health care ruling is not just political vindication. It is a personal reprieve, leaving intact his hopes of joining the ranks of Franklin D. Roosevelt, Lyndon B. Johnson and Ronald Reagan as presidents who fundamentally altered the course of the country.

articles.headline: Roberts Shows Deft Hand as Swing Vote on Health Care
articles.snippet: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. carefully took on what a predecessor called the grave task of assessing the constitutionality of a law passed by Congress.
articles.abstract: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. carefully took on what a predecessor called the grave task of assessing the constitutionality of a law passed by Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. has a favorite quotation from one of the giants who preceded him on the Supreme Court. Assessing the constitutionality of a law passed by Congress, Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr. once wrote, “is the gravest and most delicate duty that this court is called on to perform.”

articles.headline: Murdoch Sees Strengths in New Print Division
articles.snippet: After announcing plans to spin off News Corporation’s newspapers, Rupert Murdoch gave them a forceful endorsement, saying they had been “undervalued by the skeptics.”
articles.abstract: After announcing plans to spin off News Corporation’s newspapers, Rupert Murdoch gave them a forceful endorsement, saying they had been “undervalued by the skeptics.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch played offense on Thursday, embarking on a rare publicity campaign to extol the economic prospects of News Corporation’s newspapers after announcing earlier that they would be spun off into a separate company.

articles.headline: Markets Cheer Europe’s Bailout Plan
articles.snippet: Stocks on Wall Street surged after European leaders agreed to use bailout funds to recapitalize struggling banks directly. Euro zone shares closed ahead 5 percent.
articles.abstract: Stocks on Wall Street surged after European leaders agreed to use bailout funds to recapitalize struggling banks directly. Euro zone shares closed ahead 5 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the relief rally that beleaguered investors were waiting for as a new plan to tackle the European banking crisis sent stock markets in many countries to their best day of the year on Friday.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Christine Hauser
